Practice Information
Our practice will be on court 1 of Kirkland Middle School gym from 7 pm to 8pm on Monday and Wednesday nights.
Practice Information
Mondays & Wednesdays 7-8pm @ Kirkland

Our first practice is Monday, November 27
th
!

Game Information:
December 20 – Games schedules will be released on or before this date. All games are on Saturday.
January 14 – First Game of the Season

Communication:
I will be setting up a What’s App Group for sharing updates such as practice information, and communicating with parents.

Additional Information:
This year the kids will be using a full-size men’s basketball. The city of Kirkland recommends Baden Rival Basketball

I would be honored to have an assistant coach to help out. Practices run much more efficient with two. Please let me
know if you are interested.
Zach and I will be traveling from 12/4 – 12/10. We will not have practice on 12/4 or 12/6
PLEASE LET ME KNOW IF YOU ARE ON THE SKI BUS. Zach is currently signed up for ski bus. If we have
additional kids with this commitment, I will work with the city to move practice to a different weekday.

Thank you!
Joe

Subject: Fwd: Moyer Family Introduction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Wednesday, January 3, 2024 12:12:36 PM GMT-08:00
Obviously we will need a final parenting plan to share with her before we meet. Not complaining or bothering you at all...
Good A�ernoon, Ms Be�s-
Chris�ne and I have made enough progress on the paren�ng plan that we would like to re-engage if you s�ll have space for
us. I think the recommenda�on is for the kids to have their own individual therapy, and our oldest (Max) will also
par�cipate with me in reunifica�on therapy. Addi�onally, there is a litany of other therapies we will be involved with that I
am a�aching, so you have a holis�c picture of our mental health ac�vi�es. Those are in the paren�ng plan, so we need to
comply with them, but we are also open to any recommenda�ons you have as you learn more about our children and
situa�on.
This is all a new learning experience for us, and we welcome it, but the lack of a "general contractor" across the family's
mental health efforts creates a challenge. I do like the sugges�ons you have provided below, and I would like to move
forward with an intake session. Admi�edly, Chris�ne and I have struggled recently, and nerves can fray, but we will be on
our best behavior. The reason I men�on it, however, is I am not sure if 30 min will be enough vs. an hour. But I am going to
start trus�ng your good judgment on all things "kid therapy" from this point forward/ Please just let us know, and we will
cooperate.
Please take a look below for a sample of the recommenda�on from the paren�ng plan and how we work with you. Seems
pre�y straigh�orward but I'd also like for you to drive the bus here and let us know how to act in the kid's best interest
moving forward:
The children's therapist should be protected from litigation by neither parent asking for their involvement in the
custody litigation whatsoever.  Neither parent should have the "ear" of the therapist by having side conversations
with the therapist.  The therapist should not have side conversations with either parent.  Any communication
should be written and include the other parent, including communications from the therapist.  Neither parent
should coach the children as to what they should be telling the therapist.  Parents should, if possible, take turns
bringing the children to their therapy appointments.
best
Christine & robert
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Saturday, December 16, 2023 12:16 PM
To: Kari Be�s <
kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com>; Chris�ne Moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

Happy Saturday!
Thanks for the quick response. We are definitely looking forward to exploring options with you for Max, Adrian, and the
family. And I appreciate the options you outlined below. That said, over the last two days, Christine and I have both spent
considerable time with a therapist who is currently acting in a  lightweight way as our GAL to make recommendations for a
temporary parenting plan that we can use till official mediation happens. During those conversations, she offered to make
some recommendations for how we approach therapy for Max and Adrian appropriately, considering her work. So if we
could circle back next week, that would be ideal. If we need the two of you to talk directly as well, we would be happy to
arrange that.
thank you!
robert & Christine
On Thu, Dec 14, 2023 at 4:50 PM Kari Betts <
kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com> wrote:

---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Rob Moyer <
rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: "Monique (Mo) Brown" <
drmoniquebrown@gmail.com>
Cc: Christine Moyer <
christinemoyer@hotmail.com>, Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Bcc:
Date: Thu, 28 Dec 2023 20:56:44 +0000
Subject: Therapy Roundup
Hi Dr. Brown-
Christine and I are circling back on the "Therapy Recommendations" so we are sure we account for all of your
recommendations. Please see below for the summary and let us know if we have missed anything. Also please see
this note
for an ask of you, so we can move forward.
thanks again,
Christine & robert
1 Dialec�cal Behavioral Therapy program
Chris�ne will par�cipate for at least 6 months
Robert will par�cipate for 12 months
Notes: Recommenda�ons include Eastside DBT, Thira, EBT Sea�le, and the Sea�le Clinic
2 Marriage counseling
Chris�ne and Robert- Not to stay together, but to peacefully coexist for the kid's sake.
Notes: We agree this is important and would like more details of what we should work on
3 Child Therapy
Max and Adrian should go to this as soon as possible. Therapist should have the final paren�ng plan.
Notes: Kari Be�s is who we have reached out to. We will pursue her per your guidelines.
4 Substance Use Counseling
Chris�ne should be allowed a session with a substance use professional
Robert goes once per week with a provider who specializes in working with addic�on
Notes: Robert to inves�gate New Life or one of the places for the other op�ons as they o�en coexist.
5 Child Led Reunifica�on Therapy
Robert, Max and Adrian
Notes: We should start with
Toni and Sharon
Subject: Re: Moyer Family Introduction

Good A�ernoon, Ms Be�s-
Chris�ne and I have made enough progress on the paren�ng plan that we would like to re-engage if you s�ll have space for
us. I think the recommenda�on is for the kids to have their own individual therapy, and our oldest (Max) will also

par�cipate with me in reunifica�on therapy. Addi�onally, there is a litany of other therapies we will be involved with that I
am a�aching, so you have a holis�c picture of our mental health ac�vi�es. Those are in the paren�ng plan, so we need to
comply with them, but we are also open to any recommenda�ons you have as you learn more about our children and
situa�on.
This is all a new learning experience for us, and we welcome it, but the lack of a "general contractor" across the family's
mental health efforts creates a challenge. I do like the sugges�ons you have provided below, and I would like to move
forward with an intake session. Admi�edly, Chris�ne and I have struggled recently, and nerves can fray, but we will be on
our best behavior. The reason I men�on it, however, is I am not sure if 30 min will be enough vs. an hour. But I am going to
start trus�ng your good judgment on all things "kid therapy" from this point forward/ Please just let us know, and we will
cooperate.
Please take a look below for a sample of the recommenda�on from the paren�ng plan and how we work with you. Seems
pre�y straigh�orward but I'd also like for you to drive the bus here and let us know how to act in the kid's best interest
moving forward:
The children's therapist should be protected from litigation by neither parent asking for their involvement in the
custody litigation whatsoever.  Neither parent should have the "ear" of the therapist by having side conversations
with the therapist.  The therapist should not have side conversations with either parent.  Any communication
should be written and include the other parent, including communications from the therapist.  Neither parent
should coach the children as to what they should be telling the therapist.  Parents should, if possible, take turns
bringing the children to their therapy appointments.
best
Christine & robert

Happy Saturday!
Thanks for the quick response. We are definitely looking forward to exploring options with you for Max, Adrian, and the
family. And I appreciate the options you outlined below. That said, over the last two days, Christine and I have both spent
considerable time with a therapist who is currently acting in a  lightweight way as our GAL to make recommendations for a
temporary parenting plan that we can use till official mediation happens. During those conversations, she offered to make
some recommendations for how we approach therapy for Max and Adrian appropriately, considering her work. So if we
could circle back next week, that would be ideal. If we need the two of you to talk directly as well, we would be happy to
arrange that.
thank you!
robert & Christine

I think this is all I have? It has the proposal and options as I read. Happy to jump on a call to discuss if I’m missing
something.
Here is what I see:
- Two phases
- Phase I
- Phase II
- Phase II has two options
- One is 70/30
- Two is 50/50
Ideally, and I have not mentioned this, in Phase I,   I could just have every Wed for dinner with AD. It seems like it would be
a nice regular routine for his brain “Wed = Dad  Dinner Date”. Realistically my 40% in Phase I is a false narrative. Max is
not going to spend anywhere near the time I am allowed to have so it’s insincere to pretend that is actually going to happen.
Thoughts?
From the plan:
Phase 1: This phase is contingent on concurrent compliance with stipulations listed in section 14.  Should
those stipulations not be met, Robert will only have daytime visits with both children consistent with Max’s
schedule.
Max: Saturday daytime visits on weeks 1, 3, 5.  Sunday daytime visits on weeks 2, 4.  Evening visits every
Wednesday.  Max has the choice to stay overnight at Robert’s house whenever he wants, but should not feel
pressure from either parent as to what he decides.  See section 14 for further stipulations regarding entering
into phase 2.
Phase 1 should have full compliance for 4 months and transition to phase 2 should include feedback from the
children’s therapists and the reunification counselor.  Any lack of compliance will result in the plan reverting
to the previous phase.
Adrian: Adrian will reside with Robert every other weekend from Saturday 9am until Monday school drop off
(or dropped off at Christine’s home by 9am).  Robert will have a dinner visit with Adrian on Wednesdays on
his off weeks.

Phase 2:  The children will reside with Robert every other weekend from Friday 3pm to Monday 3pm and
every Wednesday from 3pm until Thursday 3pm.  The children will reside with Christine the remainder of the
time.
This is a 60/40 schedule.
Alternately, you can do a week on/week off schedule to minimize exchanges.
